key_mistakes.reason: Allows White to gain control of the center.
Exposes the queen early without gaining sufficient advantage.
Misplaces the queen, allowing White to gain a tempo.
Misses an opportunity to strengthen control over the center.
Weakens the pawn structure and does not help develop pieces.
Allows White to build a strong pawn center.
Misses a chance to push for an advantageous pawn structure.
Misplaces the knight without a clear plan.
Allows Black to gain initiative on the kingside.
Forces a trade without gaining much positional advantage.
Exchanges an active bishop for a passive piece.
Misplaces the rook, missing more active possibilities.
Misses a chance to consolidate position and strengthen the center.
Loses initiative and misses a winning move.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center with your pawns early in the game.
Avoid unnecessary piece trades that weaken your position.
Ensure your king's safety, especially when the position opens up.
Develop pieces to active squares rather than moving them multiple times early.
Be cautious with your queen's early movements to avoid losing tempo.
